Summary: A lavish, dramatic tale of love and illusion set in the famed Parisian nightclub.

Title: Jagged Little Pill
Summary: A jukebox musical using Alanis Morissette's songs to explore contemporary family dynamics and social issues.

Title: Six
Summary: The six wives of Henry VIII reclaim their stories in this modern pop concert musical.

Title: Paradise Square
Summary: Set in 19th-century New York City, it explores the story of Irish and Black Americans coexisting in the same neighborhood.

Title: Mr. Saturday Night
Summary: Follows a comedian who reflects on his career and attempts a comeback.

Title: MJ
Summary: Chronicles the creative journey and career of pop icon Michael Jackson.

Title: Girl from the North Country
Summary: Uses Bob Dylan’s music to tell intertwined stories of hard-luck residents in a 1930s Minnesota boarding house.

Title: A Strange Loop
Summary: A self-referential musical about a black gay man writing a musical about a black gay man.

Title: Some Like It Hot
Summary: A cross-dressing comedy based on the classic film about musicians fleeing from the mob.

Title: Shucked
Summary: A new comedic musical celebrating the world of corn and small-town life.

Title: New York, New York
Summary: Inspired by the iconic film, it follows intertwined stories of dreamers striving for success in post-World War II New York.

Title: Kimberly Akimbo
Summary: A teenager with a rare condition causing her to age rapidly navigates family chaos and schemes.

Title: & Juliet
Summary: An irreverent, feminist twist on the story of Juliet from Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet."

Title: Water for Elephants
Summary: Based on the bestseller, it narrates a love story set in a depression-era circus.

Title: The Outsiders
Summary: Musical adaptation of S.E. Hinton’s novel about teenage gang rivalry and friendships in the 1960s.

Title: Suffs
Summary: Explores the suffragist movement and the fight for American women's right to vote in the early 20th century.

Title: Illinoise
Summary: A new musical inspired by the music of folk artist Sufjan Stevens, specifically his album about the state of Illinois.

Title: Hell's Kitchen
Summary: A coming-of-age story set in Manhattan’s raw and often unforgiving working-class neighborhood.
